intro: Lasiodiscus holtzii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color and are borne on short stalks. Lasiodiscus holtzii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
